New Records: Anthony Volpe became the first player in World Series history to hit a grand slam and steal two bases in the same game.
Freddie Freeman set a record by homering in his sixth consecutive World Series game.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam turned the game around for the Yankees.
The Yankees scored five runs in the eighth inning to break the game open.
Freddie Freeman contributed with a home run in the first inning and an RBI grounder in the fifth.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Players and fans celebrated the victory, with Anthony Volpe receiving praise from teammates and fans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first Yankees-Dodgers World Series game at Yankee Stadium since 2003.
The Yankees avoided their first losing World Series sweep since 1976.
Others: The game was played at Yankee Stadium with a sellout crowd of 49,354.
The attendance and game details were provided.
